BitField.name: CKPDRV
BitField.description: Hyperbus CK Pad Driver Control.

BitField.name: CKNPDRV
BitField.description: Hyperbus CKN Pad Driver Control.

BitField.name: RDSDLLEN
BitField.description: Hyperbus RDS DLL Power Up Control.

RegisterGroup.name: DMA
RegisterGroup.description: DMA Controller Fully programmable, chaining capable DMA channels.

BitField.name: CH0_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 0 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH1_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 1 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH2_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 2 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH3_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 3 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH4_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 4 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH5_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 5 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH6_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 6 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH7_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 7 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH8_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 8 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH9_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 9 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH10_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 10 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH11_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 11 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH12_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 12 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH13_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 13 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH14_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 14 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH15_IEN
BitField.description: Channel 15 Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CH0_IPEND
BitField.description: Channel Interrupt. To clear an interrupt, all active interrupt bits of the DMA_ST must be cleared. The interrupt bits are set only if their corresponding interrupt enable bits are set in DMA_CN.

BitField.name: CHEN
BitField.description: Channel Enable. This bit is automatically cleared when DMA_ST.CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. Setting this bit to 1 enables DMA_SRC, DMA_DST and DMA_CNT to be reloaded with their corresponding reload registers upon count-to-zero. This bit is also writeable in the Count Reload Register. Refer to the description on Buffer Chaining for use of this bit. If buffer chaining is not used this bit must be written with a 0. This bit should be set after the reload registers have been programmed.

BitField.name: PRI
BitField.description: DMA Priority.

BitField.name: REQSEL
BitField.description: Request Select. Select DMA request line for this channel. If memory-to-memory is selected, the channel operates as if the request is always active.

BitField.name: REQWAIT
BitField.description: Request Wait Enable. When enabled, delay timer start until DMA request transitions from active to inactive.

BitField.name: TOSEL
BitField.description: Time-Out Select. Selects the number of prescale clocks seen by the channel timer before a time-out conditions is generated for this channel. Important note: since the prescaler runs independent of the individual channel timers, the actual number of Pre-Scale clock edges seen has a margin of error equal to a single Pre-Scale clock.

BitField.name: PSSEL
BitField.description: Pre-Scale Select. Selects the Pre-Scale divider for timer clock input.

BitField.name: SRCWD
BitField.description: Source Width. In most cases, this will be the data width of each AHB transactions. However, the width will be reduced in the cases where DMA_CNT indicates a smaller value.

BitField.name: SRCINC
BitField.description: Source Increment Enable. This bit enables DMA_SRC increment upon every AHB transaction. This bit is forced to 0 for DMA receive from peripherals.

BitField.name: DSTWD
BitField.description: Destination Width. Indicates the width of the each AHB transactions to the destination peripheral or memory. (The actual width may be less than this if there are insufficient bytes in the DMA FIFO for the full width).

BitField.name: DSTINC
BitField.description: Destination Increment Enable. This bit enables DMA_DST increment upon every AHB transaction. This bit is forced to 0 for DMA transmit to peripherals.

BitField.name: BRST
BitField.description: Burst Size. The number of bytes to be transferred into and out of the DMA FIFO in a single burst. Burst size equals 1 + value stored in this field.

BitField.name: CHDIEN
BitField.description: Channel Disable Interrupt Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: CTZIEN
BitField.description: Count-to-zero Interrupts Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever a count-to-zero event occurs.

BitField.name: CH_ST
BitField.description: Channel Status. This bit is used to indicate to the programmer when it is safe to change the configuration, address, and count registers for the channel. Whenever this bit is cleared by hardware, the DMA_CFG.CHEN bit is also cleared (if not cleared already).

BitField.name: IPEND
BitField.description: Channel Interrupt.

BitField.name: CTZ_ST
BitField.description: Count-to-Zero (CTZ) Status

BitField.name: RLD_ST
BitField.description: Reload Status.

BitField.name: BUS_ERR
BitField.description: Bus Error. Indicates that an AHB abort was received and the channel has been disabled.

BitField.name: TO_ST
BitField.description: Time-Out Status.

Register.name: CH[0].SRC
Register.description: Source Device Address. If SRCINC=1, the counter bits are incremented by 1,2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If SRCINC=0, this register remains constant. In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with the contents of DMA_SRC_RLD.

Register.name: CH[0].DST
Register.description: Destination Device Address. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If DSTINC=1, this register is incremented on every AHB write out of the DMA FIFO. They are incremented by 1, 2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with DMA_DST_RLD.

Register.name: CH[0].CNT
Register.description: DMA Counter. The user loads this register with the number of bytes to transfer. This counter decreases on every AHB cycle into the DMA FIFO. The decrement will be 1, 2, or 4 depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. When the counter reaches 0, a count-to-zero condition is triggered.

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: DMA Counter.

Register.name: CH[0].SRC_RLD
Register.description: Source Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_SRC upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: SRC_RLD
BitField.description: Source Address Reload Value.

Register.name: CH[0].DST_RLD
Register.description: Destination Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_DST upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: DST_RLD
BitField.description: Destination Address Reload Value.

BitField.name: CNT_RLD
BitField.description: Count Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_CNT upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. This bit should be set after the address reload registers have been programmed. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 when reload occurs.

BitField.name: CHEN
BitField.description: Channel Enable. This bit is automatically cleared when DMA_ST.CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.description: Channel Enable. This bit is automatically cleared when DMA_ST.CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. Setting this bit to 1 enables DMA_SRC, DMA_DST and DMA_CNT to be reloaded with their corresponding reload registers upon count-to-zero. This bit is also writeable in the Count Reload Register. Refer to the description on Buffer Chaining for use of this bit. If buffer chaining is not used this bit must be written with a 0. This bit should be set after the reload registers have been programmed.

BitField.name: PRI
BitField.description: DMA Priority.

BitField.name: REQSEL
BitField.description: Request Select. Select DMA request line for this channel. If memory-to-memory is selected, the channel operates as if the request is always active.

BitField.name: REQWAIT
BitField.description: Request Wait Enable. When enabled, delay timer start until DMA request transitions from active to inactive.

BitField.name: TOSEL
BitField.description: Time-Out Select. Selects the number of prescale clocks seen by the channel timer before a time-out conditions is generated for this channel. Important note: since the prescaler runs independent of the individual channel timers, the actual number of Pre-Scale clock edges seen has a margin of error equal to a single Pre-Scale clock.

BitField.name: PSSEL
BitField.description: Pre-Scale Select. Selects the Pre-Scale divider for timer clock input.

BitField.name: SRCWD
BitField.description: Source Width. In most cases, this will be the data width of each AHB transactions. However, the width will be reduced in the cases where DMA_CNT indicates a smaller value.

BitField.name: SRCINC
BitField.description: Source Increment Enable. This bit enables DMA_SRC increment upon every AHB transaction. This bit is forced to 0 for DMA receive from peripherals.

BitField.name: DSTWD
BitField.description: Destination Width. Indicates the width of the each AHB transactions to the destination peripheral or memory. (The actual width may be less than this if there are insufficient bytes in the DMA FIFO for the full width).

BitField.name: DSTINC
BitField.description: Destination Increment Enable. This bit enables DMA_DST increment upon every AHB transaction. This bit is forced to 0 for DMA transmit to peripherals.

BitField.name: BRST
BitField.description: Burst Size. The number of bytes to be transferred into and out of the DMA FIFO in a single burst. Burst size equals 1 + value stored in this field.

BitField.name: CHDIEN
BitField.description: Channel Disable Interrupt Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: CTZIEN
BitField.description: Count-to-zero Interrupts Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever a count-to-zero event occurs.

BitField.name: CH_ST
BitField.description: Channel Status. This bit is used to indicate to the programmer when it is safe to change the configuration, address, and count registers for the channel. Whenever this bit is cleared by hardware, the DMA_CFG.CHEN bit is also cleared (if not cleared already).

BitField.name: IPEND
BitField.description: Channel Interrupt.

BitField.name: CTZ_ST
BitField.description: Count-to-Zero (CTZ) Status

BitField.name: RLD_ST
BitField.description: Reload Status.

BitField.name: BUS_ERR
BitField.description: Bus Error. Indicates that an AHB abort was received and the channel has been disabled.

BitField.name: TO_ST
BitField.description: Time-Out Status.

Register.name: CH[5].SRC
Register.description: Source Device Address. If SRCINC=1, the counter bits are incremented by 1,2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If SRCINC=0, this register remains constant. Register.name: CH[5].DST

Register.name: CH[5].CNT
Register.description: DMA Counter. The user loads this register with the number of bytes to transfer. This counter decreases on every AHB cycle into the DMA FIFO. The decrement will be 1, 2, or 4 depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. When the counter reaches 0, a count-to-zero condition is triggered.

BitField.description: Destination Width. Indicates the width of the each AHB transactions to the destination peripheral or memory. (The actual width may be less than this if there are insufficient bytes in the DMA FIFO for the full width).

BitField.name: DSTINC
BitField.description: Destination Increment Enable. This bit enables DMA_DST increment upon every AHB transaction. This bit is forced to 0 for DMA transmit to peripherals.

BitField.name: BRST
BitField.description: Burst Size. The number of bytes to be transferred into and out of the DMA FIFO in a single burst. Burst size equals 1 + value stored in this field.

BitField.name: CHDIEN
BitField.description: Channel Disable Interrupt Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: CTZIEN
BitField.description: Count-to-zero Interrupts Enable. When enabled, the IPEND will be set to 1 whenever a count-to-zero event occurs.

BitField.name: CH_ST
BitField.description: Channel Status. This bit is used to indicate to the programmer when it is safe to change the configuration, address, and count registers for the channel. Whenever this bit is cleared by hardware, the DMA_CFG.CHEN bit is also cleared (if not cleared already).

BitField.name: IPEND
BitField.description: Channel Interrupt.

BitField.name: CTZ_ST
BitField.description: Count-to-Zero (CTZ) Status

BitField.name: RLD_ST
BitField.description: Reload Status.

BitField.name: BUS_ERR
BitField.description: Bus Error. Indicates that an AHB abort was received and the channel has been disabled.

BitField.name: TO_ST
BitField.description: Time-Out Status.

Register.name: CH[10].SRC
Register.description: Source Device Address. If SRCINC=1, the counter bits are incremented by 1,2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If SRCINC=0, this register remains constant. In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with the contents of DMA_SRC_RLD.

Register.name: CH[10].DST
Register.description: Destination Device Address. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If DSTINC=1, this register is incremented on every AHB write out of the DMA FIFO. They are incremented by 1, 2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with DMA_DST_RLD.

Register.name: CH[10].CNT
Register.description: DMA Counter. The user loads this register with the number of bytes to transfer. This counter decreases on every AHB cycle into the DMA FIFO. The decrement will be 1, 2, or 4 depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. When the counter reaches 0, a count-to-zero condition is triggered.

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: DMA Counter.

Register.name: CH[10].SRC_RLD
Register.description: Source Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_SRC upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: SRC_RLD
BitField.description: Source Address Reload Value.

Register.name: CH[10].DST_RLD
Register.description: Destination Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_DST upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: DST_RLD
BitField.description: Destination Address Reload Value.

BitField.name: CNT_RLD
BitField.description: Count Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_CNT upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. This bit should be set after the address reload registers have been programmed. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 when reload occurs.

BitField.name: CHEN
BitField.description: Channel Enable. This bit is automatically cleared when DMA_ST.CH_ST changes from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. Setting this bit to 1 enables DMA_SRC, DMA_DST and DMA_CNT to be reloaded with their corresponding reload registers upon count-to-zero. This bit is also writeable in the Count Reload Register. Refer to the description on Buffer Chaining for use of this bit. If buffer chaining is not used this bit must be written with a 0. This bit should be set after the reload registers have been programmed.

BitField.name: PRI
BitField.description: DMA Priority.

BitField.name: REQSEL
BitField.description: Request Select. Select DMA request line for this channel. If memory-to-memory is selected, the channel operates as if the request is always active.

BitField.name: REQWAIT
BitField.description: Request Wait Enable. When enabled, delay timer start until DMA request transitions from active to inactive.

BitField.name: TOSEL
BitField.description: Time-Out Select. Selects the number of prescale clocks seen by the channel timer before a time-out conditions is generated for this channel. Important note: since the prescaler runs independent of the individual channel timers, the actual number of Pre-Scale clock edges seen has a margin of error equal to a single Pre-Scale clock.

BitField.name: PSSEL
BitField.description: Pre-Scale Select. Selects the Pre-Scale divider for timer clock input.

In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with the contents of DMA_SRC_RLD.

Register.name: CH[15].DST
Register.description: Destination Device Address. For peripheral transfers, some or all of the actual address bits are fixed. If DSTINC=1, this register is incremented on every AHB write out of the DMA FIFO. They are incremented by 1, 2, or 4, depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. In the case where a count-to-zero condition occurs while RLDEN=1, the register is reloaded with DMA_DST_RLD.

Register.name: CH[15].CNT
Register.description: DMA Counter. The user loads this register with the number of bytes to transfer. This counter decreases on every AHB cycle into the DMA FIFO. The decrement will be 1, 2, or 4 depending on the data width of each AHB cycle. When the counter reaches 0, a count-to-zero condition is triggered.

BitField.name: CNT
BitField.description: DMA Counter.

Register.name: CH[15].SRC_RLD
Register.description: Source Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_SRC upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: SRC_RLD
BitField.description: Source Address Reload Value.

Register.name: CH[15].DST_RLD
Register.description: Destination Address Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_DST upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: DST_RLD
BitField.description: Destination Address Reload Value.

BitField.name: CNT_RLD
BitField.description: Count Reload Value. The value of this register is loaded into DMA0_CNT upon a count-to-zero condition.

BitField.name: RLDEN
BitField.description: Reload Enable. This bit should be set after the address reload registers have been programmed. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 when reload occurs.

BitField.name: ADDR
BitField.description: Address for next operation.

Register.name: FLSH_CLKDIV
Register.description: Flash Clock Divide. The clock (PLL0) is divided by this value to generate a 1 MHz clock for Flash controller.

BitField.name: CLKDIV
BitField.description: Flash Clock Divide. The clock is divided by this value to generate a 1MHz clock for flash controller.

BitField.name: WR
BitField.description: Write. This bit is automatically cleared after the operation.

BitField.name: ME
BitField.description: Mass Erase. This bit is automatically cleared after the operation.

BitField.name: PGE
BitField.description: Page Erase. This bit is automatically cleared after the operation.

BitField.name: WDTH
BitField.description: Data Width. This bits selects write data width.

BitField.name: ERASE_CODE
BitField.description: Erase Code. The ERASE_CODE must be set up property before erase operation can be initiated. These bits are automatically cleared after the operation is complete.

Enum.name: eraseAll
Enum.description: Enable Mass Erase. The debug port must be enabled.

BitField.name: PEND
BitField.description: Flash Pending. When Flash operation is in progress (busy), Flash reads and writes will fail. When PEND is set, write to all Flash registers, with exception of the Flash interrupt register, are ignored.

BitField.name: LVE
BitField.description: Low Voltage Read Enable

BitField.name: BRST
BitField.description: Burst Mode Enable.

BitField.name: UNLOCK
BitField.description: Flash Unlock. The correct unlock code must be written to these four bits before any Flash write or erase operation is allowed.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: Flash Done Interrupt. This bit is set to 1 upon Flash write or erase completion.

BitField.name: AF
BitField.description: Flash Access Fail. This bit is set when an attempt is made to write the flash while the flash is busy or the flash is locked. This bit can only be set to 1 by hardware.

BitField.name: DONEIE
BitField.description: Flash Done Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: AFIE
BitField.description: Flash Done Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Data next operation.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Data next operation.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Data next operation.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Data next operation.

Register.name: FLSH_ACNTL
Register.description: Access Control Register. Writing the ACNTL register with the following values in the order shown, allows read and write access to the system and user Information block: pflc-acntl = 0x3a7f5ca3; pflc-acntl = 0xa1e34f20; pflc-acntl = 0x9608b2c1. When unlocked, a write of any word will disable access to system and user information block. Readback of this register is always zero.

BitField.name: ACNTL
BitField.description: Access control.

BitField.name: SBUSARB
BitField.description: System bus abritration scheme. These bits are used to select between Fixed-burst abritration and Round-Robin scheme. The Round-Robin scheme is selected by default. These bits are reset by the system reset.

BitField.name: FLASH_PAGE_FLIP
BitField.description: Flips the Flash bottom and top halves. (Depending on the total flash size, each half is either 256K or 512K). Initiating a flash page flip will cause a flush of both the data buffer on the DCODE bus and the internal instruction buffer.

Enum.name: swapped
Enum.description: Bottom half mapped to logical top half and vice versa.

BitField.name: FPU_DIS
BitField.description: Floating Point Unit Disable

BitField.name: CCACHE_FLUSH
BitField.description: Code Cache Flush. This bit is used to flush the code caches and the instruction buffer of the Cortex-M4.

Enum.name: flush
Enum.description: Code Caches and CPU instruction buffer are flushed

BitField.name: SWD_DIS
BitField.description: Serial Wire Debug Disable

BitField.name: DMA
BitField.description: DMA Reset.

BitField.name: WDT
BitField.description: Watchdog Timer Reset.

BitField.name: GPIO0
BitField.description: GPIO0 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets GPIO0 pins to their default states.

BitField.name: TIMER0
BitField.description: Timer0 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets Timer 0 blocks.

BitField.name: TIMER1
BitField.description: Timer1 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets Timer 1 blocks.

BitField.name: TIMER2
BitField.description: Timer2 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets Timer 2 blocks.

BitField.name: UART0
BitField.description: UART0 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets all UART 0 blocks.

BitField.name: UART1
BitField.description: UART1 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets all UART 1 blocks.

BitField.name: SPI0
BitField.description: SPI0 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets all SPI 0 blocks.

BitField.name: SPI1
BitField.description: SPI1 Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets all SPI 1 blocks.

BitField.name: I2C0
BitField.description: I2C0 Reset.

BitField.name: RTC
BitField.description: Real Time Clock Reset.

BitField.name: SRST
BitField.description: Soft Reset.Write 1 to perform a Soft Reset. A soft reset performs a Peripheral Reset and also resets the GPIO peripheral but does not reset the CPU or Watchdog Timer.

BitField.name: PRST
BitField.description: Peripheral Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets all peripherals. The CPU core, the watchdog timer, and all GPIO pins are unaffected by this reset.

BitField.name: SYSTEM
BitField.description: System Reset. Setting this bit to 1 resets the CPU core and all peripherals, including the watchdog timer.

BitField.name: PSC
BitField.description: Prescaler Select. This 3 bit field sets the system operating frequency by controlling the prescaler that divides the output of the PLL0.

BitField.name: CLKSEL
BitField.description: Clock Source Select. This 3 bit field selects the source for the system clock.

Enum.name: cryptoOsc
Enum.description: Crypto oscillator is used for the system clock.

Enum.name: hfxIn
Enum.description: HFXIN is used for the system clock.

Enum.name: nanoRing
Enum.description: The nano-ring output is used for the system clock.

Enum.name: HIRC96
Enum.description: The internal 96 MHz oscillator is used for the system clock.

Enum.name: HIRC8
Enum.description: The internal 8 MHz oscillator is used for the system clock.

BitField.name: CKRDY
BitField.description: Clock Ready. This read only bit reflects whether the currently selected system clock source is running.

Enum.name: busy
Enum.description: Switchover to the new clock source (as selected by CLKSEL) has not yet occurred.

Enum.name: ready
Enum.description: System clock running from CLKSEL clock source.

BitField.name: X32K_EN
BitField.description: 32kHz Crystal Oscillator Enable.

BitField.name: HIRC_EN
BitField.description: 60MHz High Frequency Internal Reference Clock Enable.

BitField.name: X32K_RDY
BitField.description: 32kHz Crystal Oscillator Ready

BitField.name: HIRC_RDY
BitField.description: 60MHz HIRC Ready.

BitField.name: LIRC8K_RDY
BitField.description: 8kHz Low Frequency Reference Clock Ready.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Operating Mode. This two bit field selects the current operating mode for the device. Note that code execution only occurs during ACTIVE mode.

BitField.name: GPIOWKEN
BitField.description: GPIO Wake Up Enable. This bit enables all GPIO pins as potential wakeup sources. Any GPIO configured for wakeup is capable of causing an exit from IDLE or STANDBY modes when this bit is set.

BitField.name: RTCWKEN
BitField.description: RTC Alarm Wake Up Enable. This bit enables RTC alarm as wakeup source. If enabled, the desired RTC alarm must be configured via the RTC control registers.

BitField.name: HIRCPD
BitField.description: HIRC Power Down. This bit selects HIRC power state in DEEPSLEEP mode.

BitField.name: AONCD
BitField.description: Always-ON(AON) domain CLock Divider. These bits define the AON domain clock divider.

BitField.name: GPIO0D
BitField.description: GPIO0 Disable.

BitField.name: DMAD
BitField.description: DMA Disable.

BitField.name: SPI0D
BitField.description: SPI 0 Disable.

BitField.name: SPI1D
BitField.description: SPI 1 Disable.

BitField.name: UART0D
BitField.description: UART 0 Disable.

BitField.name: UART1D
BitField.description: UART 1 Disable.

BitField.name: I2C0D
BitField.description: I2C 0 Disable.

BitField.name: T0D
BitField.description: Timer 0 Disable.

BitField.name: T1D
BitField.description: Timer 1 Disable.

BitField.name: T2D
BitField.description: Timer 2 Disable.

BitField.name: I2C1D
BitField.description: I2C 1 Disable.

BitField.name: FWS
BitField.description: Flash Wait State. These bits define the number of wait-state cycles per Flash data read access. Minimum wait state is 2.

BitField.name: SYSRAM0LS
BitField.description: System RAM 0 Light Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: light_sleep
Enum.description: Memory is in Light Sleep mode.

BitField.name: SYSRAM1LS
BitField.description: System RAM 1 Light Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: light_sleep
Enum.description: Memory is in Light Sleep mode.

BitField.name: SYSRAM2LS
BitField.description: System RAM 2 Light Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: light_sleep
Enum.description: Memory is in Light Sleep mode.

BitField.name: SYSRAM3LS
BitField.description: System RAM 3 Light Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: light_sleep
Enum.description: Memory is in Light Sleep mode.

BitField.name: ICACHELS
BitField.description: ICache RAM Light Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: light_sleep
Enum.description: Memory is in Light Sleep mode.

BitField.name: SRAM0Z
BitField.description: System RAM Block 0.

BitField.name: ICACHEZ
BitField.description: Instruction Cache.

BitField.name: ICECLOCK
BitField.description: ARM ICE Lock Status.

BitField.name: CODEINTERR
BitField.description: Code Integrity Error Flag. This bit indicates a code integrity error has occured in XiP interface.

BitField.name: SCMEMF
BitField.description: System Cache Memory Fault Flag. This bit indicates a memory fault has occured in the System Cache while receiving data from the Hyperbus Interface.

BitField.name: I2C1
BitField.description: I2C1 Reset.

BitField.name: FLCD
BitField.description: Secure Flash Controller Disable.

BitField.name: ICACHED
BitField.description: ICache Clock Disable.

BitField.name: DMAEVENT
BitField.description: Enable DMA event. When this bit is set, a DMA event will cause an RXEV event to wake the CPU from WFE sleep mode.

BitField.name: RXEVENT
BitField.description: Enable RXEV pin event. When this bit is set, a logic high of GPIO0[24] will cause an RXEV event to wake the CPU from WFE sleep mode.

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Manufacturer Chip Revision.

BitField.name: ICEULIE
BitField.description: ARM ICE Unlock Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: CIEIE
BitField.description: Code Integrity Error Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: SCMFIE
BitField.description: System Cache Memory Fault Interrupt Enable.

Register.name: EN
Register.description: GPIO Function Enable Register. Each bit controls the GPIO_EN setting for one GPIO pin on the associated port.

BitField.name: GPIO_EN
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: EN_SET
Register.description: GPIO Set Function Enable Register. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register sets the bits in the same positions in GPIO_EN to 1, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: EN_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Clear Function Enable Register. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_EN to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: OUT_EN
Register.description: GPIO Output Enable Register. Each bit controls the GPIO_OUT_EN setting for one GPIO pin in the associated port.

BitField.name: GPIO_OUT_EN
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: OUT_EN_SET
Register.description: GPIO Output Enable Set Function Enable Register. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register sets the bits in the same positions in GPIO_OUT_EN to 1, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: OUT_EN_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Output Enable Clear Function Enable Register. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_OUT_EN to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: OUT
Register.description: GPIO Output Register. Each bit controls the GPIO_OUT setting for one pin in the associated port. This register can be written either directly, or by using the GPIO_OUT_SET and GPIO_OUT_CLR registers.

BitField.name: GPIO_OUT
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: OUT_SET
Register.description: GPIO Output Set. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register sets the bits in the same positions in GPIO_OUT to 1, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: GPIO_OUT_SET
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.name: set
Enum.description: Set GPIO_OUT bit in this position to '1'

Register.name: OUT_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Output Clear. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_OUT to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: GPIO_OUT_CLR
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.name: IN
Register.description: GPIO Input Register. Read-only register to read from the logic states of the GPIO pins on this port.

BitField.name: GPIO_IN
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Register.description: GPIO Interrupt Mode Register. Each bit in this register controls the interrupt mode setting for the associated GPIO pin on this port.

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_MOD
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.description: Interrupts for this pin are level triggered.

Enum.name: edge
Enum.description: Interrupts for this pin are edge triggered.

Register.name: INT_POL
Register.description: GPIO Interrupt Polarity Register. Each bit in this register controls the interrupt polarity setting for one GPIO pin in the associated port.

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_POL
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.name: falling
Enum.description: Interrupts are latched on a falling edge or low level condition for this pin.

Enum.name: rising
Enum.description: Interrupts are latched on a rising edge or high condition for this pin.

Register.name: INT_EN
Register.description: GPIO Interrupt Enable Register. Each bit in this register controls the GPIO interrupt enable for the associated pin on the GPIO port.

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_EN
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.description: Interrupts are disabled for this GPIO pin.

Enum.name: en

Register.name: INT_EN_SET

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_EN_SET
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.name: set
Enum.description: Set GPIO_INT_EN bit in this position to '1'

Register.name: INT_EN_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_INT_EN to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_EN_CLR
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.name: clear
Enum.description: Clear GPIO_INT_EN bit in this position to '0'

Register.name: INT_STAT
Register.description: GPIO Interrupt Status Register. Each bit in this register contains the pending interrupt status for the associated GPIO pin in this port.

BitField.name: GPIO_INT_STAT
BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.name: no
Enum.description: No Interrupt is pending on this GPIO pin.

Enum.name: pending
Enum.description: An Interrupt is pending on this GPIO pin.

Register.name: INT_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Status Clear. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_INT_STAT to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL

BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.description: PMU wakeup for this GPIO is disabled.

Enum.name: en
Enum.description: PMU wakeup for this GPIO is enabled.

Register.name: WAKE_EN_SET
Register.description: GPIO Wake Enable Set. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register sets the bits in the same positions in GPIO_WAKE_EN to 1, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL

Register.name: WAKE_EN_CLR
Register.description: GPIO Wake Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to one or more bits in this register clears the bits in the same positions in GPIO_WAKE_EN to 0, without affecting other bits in that register.

BitField.name: ALL

BitField.description: Mask of all of the pins on the port.

Enum.description: Dual Edge mode is enabled. If edge-triggered interrupts are enabled on this GPIO pin, then both rising and falling edges will trigger interrupts regardless of the GPIO_INT_POL setting.

Register.name: PAD_CFG1
Register.description: GPIO Input Mode Config 1. Each bit in this register enables the weak pull-up for the associated GPIO pin in this port.

BitField.name: GPIO_PAD_CFG1
BitField.description: The two bits in GPIO_PAD_CFG1 and GPIO_PAD_CFG2 for each GPIO pin work together to determine the pad mode when the GPIO is set to input mode.

Register.name: PAD_CFG2
Register.description: GPIO Input Mode Config 2. Each bit in this register enables the weak pull-up for the associated GPIO pin in this port.

BitField.name: GPIO_PAD_CFG2
BitField.description: The two bits in GPIO_PAD_CFG1 and GPIO_PAD_CFG2 for each GPIO pin work together to determine the pad mode when the GPIO is set to input mode.

BitField.description: Data Acknowledge. This bit defines the acknowledge bit returned by the I2C receiver while IRXM = 1 HW forces ACK to 0 when IRXM = 0.

BitField.name: READ
BitField.description: Read. This bit reflects the R/W bit of an address match (AMI = 1) or general call match(GCI = 1). This bit is valid 3 cycles after the relevant interrupt bit is set.

BitField.name: SCL_PP_MODE
BitField.description: SCL Push-Pull Mode. This bit controls whether SCL is operated in a the I2C standard open-drain mode, or in a non-standard push-pull mode where the Hi-Z output isreplaced with Drive-1. The non-standard mode should only be used when operating as a master and communicating with slaves that are guaranteed to never drive SCL low.

Enum.description: Standard open-drain operation: drive low for 0, Hi-Z for 1

Enum.name: en
Enum.description: Non-standard push-pull operation: drive low for 0, drive high for 1

BitField.name: RX_THRESH
BitField.description: RX FIFO Above Treshold Level Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: TX_THRESH
BitField.description: TX FIFO Below Treshold Level Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Stop Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ADDR_ACK
BitField.description: Received Address ACK from Slave Interrupt.

BitField.name: ARB_ER
BitField.description: Master Mode Arbitration Lost Interrupt.

BitField.name: TO_ER
BitField.description: Timeout Error Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: ADDR_ER
BitField.description: Master Mode Address NACK Received Interrupt.

BitField.name: DATA_ER
BitField.description: Master Mode Data NACK Received Interrupt.

BitField.name: DO_NOT_RESP_ER
BitField.description: Slave Mode Do Not Respond Interrupt.

BitField.name: START_ER
BitField.description: Out of Sequence START condition detected interrupt.

BitField.name: STOP_ER
BitField.description: Out of Sequence STOP condition detected interrupt.

BitField.name: TX_LOCK_OUT
BitField.description: TX FIFO Locked Out Interrupt.

BitField.name: RX_OVERFLOW
BitField.description: Receiver Overflow Interrupt. When operating as a slave receiver, this bit is set when you reach the first data bit and the RX FIFO and shift register are both full.

BitField.name: TX_UNDERFLOW
BitField.description: Transmit Underflow Interrupt. When operating as a slave transmitter, this bit is set when you reach the first data bit and the TX FIFO is empty and the master is still asking for more data (i.e the master hasn't sent a NACK yet).

BitField.name: RX_OVERFLOW
BitField.description: Receiver Overflow Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: TX_UNDERFLOW
BitField.description: Transmit Underflow Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: RX_LEN
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Length.

BitField.name: TX_LEN
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Length.

BitField.name: DNR
BitField.description: Do Not Respond.

Enum.name: not_respond_rx_fifo_empty
Enum.description: Do not respond to address match when RX_FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RX_FLUSH
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Flush. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 after the operation. Setting this bit to 1 will affect RX_FIFO status.

BitField.name: RX_THRESH
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Threshold. These bits define the RX_FIFO interrupt threshold.

BitField.name: RX_CNT
BitField.description: Receive Count Bits. These bits define the number of bytes to be received in a transaction, except for the case RXCNT = 0. RXCNT = 0 means 256 bytes to be received in a transaction.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Count. These bits reflect the number of byte in the RX_FIFO. These bits are flushed when I2CEN = 0.

BitField.name: TX_PRELOAD
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Preaload Mode. Setting this bit will allow for high speed application to preload the transmit FIFO prior to Slave Address Match.

BitField.name: TX_READY_MODE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Ready Manual Mode.

BitField.name: TX_FLUSH
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Flush. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 after the operation.

BitField.name: TX_THRESH
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Threshold. These bits define the TX_FIFO interrupt threshold.

BitField.name: TX_READY
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Preload Ready.

BitField.name: TX_LAST
BitField.description: Transmit Last. This bit is used in slave mod only. Do not use when preloading (cleared by hardware).

Enum.name: hold_scl_low
Enum.description: Hold SCL low on TX_FIFO empty.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Count. These bits reflect the number of bytes in the TX_FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Data is read from or written to this location. Transmit and receive FIFO are separate but both are addressed at this location.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 will start a master transfer.

BitField.name: RESTART
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 will generate a repeated START.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: Setting this bit to 1 will generate a STOP condition.

BitField.name: SL_EX_ADDR
BitField.description: Slave Extend Address Select.

BitField.name: MASTER_CODE
BitField.description: Master Code. These bits set the Master Code used in Hs-mode operation.

BitField.name: SCL_SPEED_UP
BitField.description: Serial Clock speed Up. Setting this bit disables the master's monitoring of SCL state for other external masters or slaves.

BitField.name: CLK_LO
BitField.description: Clock low. In master mode, these bits define the SCL low period. In slave mode, these bits define the time SCL will be held low after data is outputted.

BitField.name: CKH
BitField.description: Clock High. In master mode, these bits define the SCL high period.

BitField.name: TO
BitField.description: Timeout. Timeout = I2C_CLKIN * (TO*8+3).

BitField.name: SLAVE_ADDR
BitField.description: Slave Address.

BitField.name: EX_ADDR
BitField.description: Extended Address Select.

BitField.name: TX_EN
BitField.description: TX channel enable.

BitField.name: RX_EN
BitField.description: RX channel enable.

BitField.name: RELNUM
BitField.description: Release Number. Identifies the RTL release version.

BitField.name: PARTNUM
BitField.description: Part Number. This field reflects the value of C_ID_PART_NUMBER configuration parameter.

BitField.name: CCHID
BitField.description: Cache ID. This field reflects the value of the C_ID_CACHEID configuration parameter.

BitField.name: CCHSZ
BitField.description: Cache Size. Indicates total size in Kbytes of cache.

BitField.name: MEMSZ
BitField.description: Main Memory Size. Indicates the total size, in units of 128 Kbytes, of code memory accessible to the cache controller.

BitField.name: CACHE_EN
BitField.description: Cache Enable. Controls whether the cache is bypassed or is in use. Changing the state of this bit will cause the instruction cache to be flushed and its contents invalidated.

Enum.name: dis
Enum.description: Cache Bypassed. Instruction data is stored in the line fill buffer but is not written to main cache memory array.

BitField.name: CACHE_RDY
BitField.description: Cache Ready flag. Cleared by hardware when at any time the cache as a whole is invalidated (including a system reset). When this bit is 0, the cache is effectively in bypass mode (instruction fetches will come from main memory or from the line fill buffer). Set by hardware when the invalidate operation is complete and the cache is ready.

BitField.name: RELNUM
BitField.description: Release Number. Identifies the RTL release version.

BitField.name: PARTNUM
BitField.description: Part Number. This field reflects the value of C_ID_PART_NUMBER configuration parameter.

BitField.name: CCHID
BitField.description: Cache ID. This field reflects the value of the C_ID_CACHEID configuration parameter.

BitField.name: CCHSZ
BitField.description: Cache Size. Indicates total size in Kbytes of cache.

BitField.name: MEMSZ
BitField.description: Main Memory Size. Indicates the total size, in units of 128 Kbytes, of code memory accessible to the cache controller.

BitField.name: CACHE_EN
BitField.description: Cache Enable. Controls whether the cache is bypassed or is in use. Changing the state of this bit will cause the instruction cache to be flushed and its contents invalidated.

Enum.name: dis
Enum.description: Cache Bypassed. Instruction data is stored in the line fill buffer but is not written to main cache memory array.

BitField.name: CACHE_RDY
BitField.description: Cache Ready flag. Cleared by hardware when at any time the cache as a whole is invalidated (including a system reset). When this bit is 0, the cache is effectively in bypass mode (instruction fetches will come from main memory or from the line fill buffer). Set by hardware when the invalidate operation is complete and the cache is ready.

RegisterGroup.name: PWRSEQ
RegisterGroup.description: Power Sequencer / Low Power Control Register.

BitField.name: RAMRET
BitField.description: System RAM retention in BACKUP mode. These two bits are used in conjuction with RREGEN bit.

Enum.name: en3
Enum.description: Enable System RAM 0 and 1 retention, if RREGEN=0, Enable all System RAM retention.

BitField.name: RREGEN
BitField.description: Retention Regulator Enable. This bit controls the retention regulator in BACKUP mode.

BitField.name: BCKGRND
BitField.description: Background Mode ENable. This bit allows low-power background mode operations, while the CPU is in DeepSleep.

BitField.name: FWKM
BitField.description: Fast Wake-Up Mode. This bit enables fast wake-up from DeepSleep mode. (5uS typical).

BitField.name: BGOFF
BitField.description: Bandgap OFF. This controls the System Bandgap in DeepSleep mode.

Enum.name: off
Enum.description: Bandgap is OFF in DeepSleep mode(default).

BitField.name: PORVDDCMD
BitField.description: VDDC(VCore) Power-On Reset Monitor Disable. This bit controls the Power-On Reset monitor on VDDC supply in DeepSleep and BACKUP mode.

BitField.name: VDDCMD
BitField.description: VDDC(Vcore) Monitor Disable. This bit controls the power monitor on the VCore supply in all operating modes.

BitField.name: VRTCMD
BitField.description: VRTC Monitor Disable. This bit controls the power monitor on the Always-On Supply in all operating modes.

BitField.name: VDDAMD
BitField.description: VDDA Monitor Disable. This bit controls the power monitor of the Analog Supply in all operating modes.

BitField.name: VDDIOMD
BitField.description: VDDIO Monitor Disable. This bit controls the power monitor of the Analog Supply in all operating modes.

BitField.name: VDDIOHMD
BitField.description: VFDDIOH Monitor Disable. This bit controls the power monitor of the Analog Supply in all operating modes.

BitField.name: PORVDDIOMD
BitField.description: VDDIO Power-On Reset Monitor Disable. This bit controls the Power-On Reset monitor on VDDIO supply in all operating mods.

BitField.name: PORVDDIOHMD
BitField.description: VDDIOH Power-On Reset Monitor Disable. This bit controls the Power-On Reset monitor on VDDIOH supply in all operating mods.

BitField.name: VDDBMD
BitField.description: VDDB Power-On Reset Monitor Disable. This bit controls the Power-On Reset monitor on VDDB supply in all operating mods.

Register.name: LPWKST0
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Status Register 0. This register indicates the low power wakeup status for GPIO0.

BitField.name: WAKEST
BitField.description: Wakeup IRQ flags (write ones to clear). One or more of these bits will be set when the corresponding dedicated GPIO pin(s) transition(s) from low to high or high to low. If GPIO wakeup source is selected, using PM.GPIOWKEN register, and the corresponding bit is also selected in LPWKEN register, an interrupt will be gnerated to wake up the CPU from a low power mode.

Register.name: LPWKEN0
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Enable Register 0. This register enables low power wakeup functionality for GPIO0.

BitField.name: WAKEEN
BitField.description: Enable wakeup. These bits allow wakeup from the corresponding GPIO pin(s) on transition(s) from low to high or high to low when PM.GPIOWKEN is set. Wakeup status is indicated in PPWKST register.

Register.name: LPWKST1
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Status Register 1. This register indicates the low power wakeup status for GPIO1.

BitField.name: WAKEST
BitField.description: Wakeup IRQ flags (write ones to clear). One or more of these bits will be set when the corresponding dedicated GPIO pin(s) transition(s) from low to high or high to low. If GPIO wakeup source is selected, using PM.GPIOWKEN register, and the corresponding bit is also selected in LPWKEN register, an interrupt will be gnerated to wake up the CPU from a low power mode.

Register.name: LPWKEN1
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Enable Register 1. This register enables low power wakeup functionality for GPIO1.

BitField.name: WAKEEN
BitField.description: Enable wakeup. These bits allow wakeup from the corresponding GPIO pin(s) on transition(s) from low to high or high to low when PM.GPIOWKEN is set. Wakeup status is indicated in PPWKST register.

Register.name: LPWKST2
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Status Register 2. This register indicates the low power wakeup status for GPIO2.

BitField.name: WAKEST
BitField.description: Wakeup IRQ flags (write ones to clear). One or more of these bits will be set when the corresponding dedicated GPIO pin(s) transition(s) from low to high or high to low. If GPIO wakeup source is selected, using PM.GPIOWKEN register, and the corresponding bit is also selected in LPWKEN register, an interrupt will be gnerated to wake up the CPU from a low power mode.

Register.name: LPWKEN2
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Enable Register 2. This register enables low power wakeup functionality for GPIO2.

BitField.name: WAKEEN
BitField.description: Enable wakeup. These bits allow wakeup from the corresponding GPIO pin(s) on transition(s) from low to high or high to low when PM.GPIOWKEN is set. Wakeup status is indicated in PPWKST register.

Register.name: LPWKST3
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Status Register 3. This register indicates the low power wakeup status for GPIO3.

BitField.name: WAKEST
BitField.description: Wakeup IRQ flags (write ones to clear). One or more of these bits will be set when the corresponding dedicated GPIO pin(s) transition(s) from low to high or high to low. If GPIO wakeup source is selected, using PM.GPIOWKEN register, and the corresponding bit is also selected in LPWKEN register, an interrupt will be gnerated to wake up the CPU from a low power mode.

Register.name: LPWKEN3
Register.description: Low Power I/O Wakeup Enable Register 3. This register enables low power wakeup functionality for GPIO3.

BitField.name: WAKEEN
BitField.description: Enable wakeup. These bits allow wakeup from the corresponding GPIO pin(s) on transition(s) from low to high or high to low when PM.GPIOWKEN is set. Wakeup status is indicated in PPWKST register.

Register.name: LPPWST
Register.description: Low Power Peripheral Wakeup Status Register.

BitField.name: USBLSWKST
BitField.description: USB UTMI Linestate Detect Wakeup Flag(write one to clear). One or both of these bits will be set when the USB bus activity causes the linestate to change and the device to wake while USB wakeup is enabled using PMLUSBWKEN.

BitField.name: USBVBUSWKST
BitField.description: USB VBUS Detect Wakeup Flag (write one to clear). This bit will be set when the USB power supply is powered on or powered off.

BitField.name: SDMAWKST
BitField.description: Smart DMA Detect Wakeup Flag (write one to clear). This bit will be set when the SDMA IRQ transition from low to high or on high to low.

BitField.name: BBMODEST
BitField.description: Battery Back Wakeup Flag (write one to clear). This bit will be set when exiting Battery Backup Mode.

Register.name: LPPWEN
Register.description: Low Power Peripheral Wakeup Enable Register.

BitField.name: USBLSWKEN
BitField.description: USB UTMI Linestate Detect Wakeup Enable. These bits allow wakeup from the corresponding USB linestate signal(s) on transition(s) from low to high or high to low when PM.USBWKEN is set.

BitField.name: USBVBUSWKEN
BitField.description: USB VBUS Detect Wakeup Enable. This bit allows wakeup from the USB power supply on or off status.

BitField.name: SDMAWKEN
BitField.description: Smart DMA Wakeup Enable. This bit allows wakeup from the Smart DMA IRQ.

BitField.name: SRAM0SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 0 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM1SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 1 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM2SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 2 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM3SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 3 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM4SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 4 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM5SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 5 Shut Down.

BitField.name: SRAM6SD
BitField.description: System RAM block 6 Shut Down.

BitField.name: ICACHESD
BitField.description: Instruction Cache RAM Shut Down.

BitField.name: ICACHEXIPSD
BitField.description: XiP Instruction Cache RAM Shut Down.

BitField.name: SCACHESD
BitField.description: System Cache RAM Shut Down.

BitField.name: CRYPTOSD
BitField.description: Crypto MAA RAM Shut Down.

BitField.name: USBFIFOSD
BitField.description: USB FIFO Shut Down.

BitField.name: ROMSD
BitField.description: ROM Shut Down.

BitField.name: ROM1SD
BitField.description: ROM1 Shut Down.

BitField.name: IC1SD
BitField.description: ICache 1 Shut Down.

Register.name: SEC
Register.description: RTC Second Counter. This register contains the 32-bit second counter.

Register.name: SSEC
Register.description: RTC Sub-second Counter. This counter increments at 256Hz. RTC_SEC is incremented when this register rolls over from 0xFF to 0x00.

BitField.name: RTSS
BitField.description: RTC Sub-second Counter.

BitField.name: RAS
BitField.description: Time-of-day Alarm.

Register.name: RSSA
Register.description: RTC sub-second alarm. This register contains the reload value for the sub-second alarm.

BitField.name: RSSA
BitField.description: This register contains the reload value for the sub-second alarm.

BitField.name: RTCE
BitField.description: Real Time Clock Enable. This bit enables the Real Time Clock. This bit can only be written when WE=1 and BUSY =0. Change to this bit is effective only after BUSY is cleared from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: ADE
BitField.description: Alarm Time-of-Day Interrupt Enable. Change to this bit is effective only after BUSY is cleared from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: ASE
BitField.description: Alarm Sub-second Interrupt Enable. Change to this bit is effective only after BUSY is cleared from 1 to 0.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: RTC Busy. This bit is set to 1 by hardware when changes to RTC registers required a synchronized version of the register to be in place. This bit is automatically cleared by hardware.

BitField.name: RDY
BitField.description: RTC Ready. This bit is set to 1 by hardware when the RTC count registers update. It can be cleared to 0 by software at any time. It will also be cleared to 0 by hardware just prior to an update of the RTC count register.

BitField.name: RDYE
BitField.description: RTC Ready Interrupt Enable.

BitField.name: ALDF
BitField.description: Time-of-Day Alarm Interrupt Flag. This alarm is qualified as wake-up source to the processor.

BitField.name: ALSF
BitField.description: Sub-second Alarm Interrupt Flag. This alarm is qualified as wake-up source to the processor.

BitField.name: SQE
BitField.description: Square Wave Output Enable.

BitField.name: FT
BitField.description: Frequency Output Selection. When SQE=1, these bits specify the output frequency on the SQW pin.

BitField.name: X32KMD
BitField.description: 32KHz Oscillator Mode.

Enum.name: noiseImmuneMode
Enum.description: Always operate in Noise Immune Mode. Oscillator warm-up required.

Enum.name: quietMode
Enum.description: Always operate in Quiet Mode. No oscillator warm-up required.

Enum.name: quietInStopWithWarmup
Enum.description: Operate in Noise Immune Mode normally, switch to Quiet Mode on Stop Mode entry. Will wait for 32K oscillator warm-up before code execution on Stop Mode exit.

Enum.name: quietInStopNoWarmup
Enum.description: Operate in Noise Immune Mode normally, switch to Quiet Mode on Stop Mode entry. Will not wait for 32K oscillator warm-up before code execution on Stop Mode exit.

BitField.name: WE
BitField.description: Write Enable. This register bit serves as a protection mechanism against unintentional writes to critical RTC bits.

BitField.name: TRIM
BitField.description: RTC Trim. This register contains the 2's complement value that specifies the trim resolution. Each increment or decrement of the bit adds or subtracts 1ppm at each 4KHz clock value, with a maximum correction of +/- 127ppm.

BitField.name: VBATTMR
BitField.description: VBAT Timer Value. When RTC is running off of VBAT, this field is incremented every 32 seconds.

BitField.name: FLITER_EN
BitField.description: RTC Oscillator Filter Enable

BitField.name: IBIAS_SEL
BitField.description: RTC Oscillator 4X Bias Current Select

Enum.name: 2X
Enum.description: Selects 2X bias current for RTC oscillator

Enum.name: 4X
Enum.description: Selects 4X bias current for RTC oscillator

BitField.name: HYST_EN
BitField.description: RTC Oscillator Hysteresis Buffer Enable

BitField.name: IBIAS_EN
BitField.description: RTC Oscillator Bias Current Enable

BitField.name: BYPASS
BitField.description: RTC Crystal Bypass

BitField.name: 32KOUT
BitField.description: RTC 32kHz Square Wave Output

BitField.name: MAGIC
BitField.description: Magic Word Validation. This bit is set by the system initialization block following power-up.

Enum.name: magicNotSet
Enum.description: Magic word was not set (OTP has not been initialized properly).

Enum.name: magicSet
Enum.description: Magic word was set (OTP contains valid settings).

BitField.name: CRCERR
BitField.description: CRC Error Status. This bit is set by the system initialization block following power-up.

Enum.name: noError
Enum.description: No CRC errors occurred during the read of the OTP memory block.

Enum.name: error
Enum.description: A CRC error occurred while reading the OTP. The address of the failure location in the OTP memory is stored in the ERRADDR register.

Register.name: ERRADDR
Register.description: Read-only field set by the SIB block if a CRC error occurs during the read of the OTP memory. Contains the failing address in OTP memory (when CRCERR equals 1).

BitField.name: FPU
BitField.description: FPU Function.

BitField.name: USB
BitField.description: USB Device.

BitField.name: ADC
BitField.description: 10-bit Sigma Delta ADC.

BitField.name: XIP
BitField.description: XiP function.

BitField.name: PBM
BitField.description: PBM function.

BitField.name: HBC
BitField.description: HBC function.

BitField.name: SDHC
BitField.description: SDHC function.

BitField.name: SMPHR
BitField.description: SMPHR function.

BitField.name: SCACHE
BitField.description: System Cache function.

BitField.name: TRNG
BitField.description: TRNG function.

BitField.name: AES
BitField.description: AES function.

BitField.name: SHA
BitField.description: SHA function.

BitField.name: MAA
BitField.description: MAA function.

RegisterGroup.name: SMON
RegisterGroup.description: The Security Monitor block used to monitor system threat conditions.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN0
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 0.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN1
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 1.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN2
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 2.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN3
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 3.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN4
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 4.

BitField.name: EXTS_EN5
BitField.description: External Sensor Enable for input/output pair 5.

BitField.name: EXTCNT
BitField.description: External Sensor Error Counter. These bits set the number of external sensor accepted mismatches that have to occur within a single bit period before an external sensor alarm is triggered.

BitField.name: EXTFRQ
BitField.description: External Sensor Frequency. These bits define the frequency at which the external sensors are clocked to/from the EXTS_IN and EXTS_OUT pair.

BitField.name: DIVCLK
BitField.description: Clock Divide. These bits are used to divide the 8KHz input clock. The resulting divided clock is used for all logic within the Security Monitor Block. Note: If the input clock is divided with these bits, the error count threshold table and output frequency will be affected accordingly with the same divide factor.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is set to 1 by hardware after EXTSCN register is written to. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 after this register information has been transferred to the security monitor domain.

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: Lock Register. Once locked, the EXTSCN register can no longer be modified. Only a battery disconnect will clear this bit. VBAT powers this register.

BitField.name: SHIELD_EN
BitField.description: Die Shield Enable.

BitField.name: TEMP_EN
BitField.description: Temperature Sensor Enable.

BitField.name: VBAT_EN
BitField.description: Battery Monitor Enable.

BitField.name: LOTEMP_SEL
BitField.description: Low Temperature Detection Select.

BitField.name: VCORELOEN
BitField.description: VCORE Undervoltage Detect Enable.

BitField.name: VCOREHIEN
BitField.description: VCORE Overvoltage Detect Enable.

BitField.name: VDDLOEN
BitField.description: VDD Undervoltage Detect Enable.

BitField.name: VDDHIEN
BitField.description: VDD Overvoltage Detect Enable.

BitField.name: VGLEN
BitField.description: Voltage Glitch Detection Enable.

BitField.name: LOCK
BitField.description: Lock Register. Once locked, the INTSCN register can no longer be modified. Only a battery disconnect will clear this bit. VBAT powers this register.

BitField.name: DRS
BitField.description: Destructive Reset Trigger. Setting this bit will generate a DRS. This bit is self-cleared by hardware.

BitField.name: KEYWIPE
BitField.description: Key Wipe Trigger. Set to 1 to initiate a wipe of the AES key register. It does not reset the part, or log a timestamp. AES and DES registers are not affected by this bit. This bit is automatically cleared to 0 after the keys have been wiped.

BitField.name: SHIELDF
BitField.description: Die Shield Flag.

BitField.name: LOTEMP
BitField.description: Low Temperature Detect.

BitField.name: HITEMP
BitField.description: High Temperature Detect.

BitField.name: BATLO
BitField.description: Battery Undervoltage Detect.

BitField.name: BATHI
BitField.description: Battery Overvoltage Detect.

BitField.name: EXTF
BitField.description: External Sensor Flag. This bit is set to 1 when any of the EXTSTAT bits are set.

BitField.name: VDDLO
BitField.description: VDD Undervoltage Detect Flag.

BitField.name: VCORELO
BitField.description: VCORE Undervoltage Detect Flag.

BitField.name: VCOREHI
BitField.description: VCORE Overvoltage Detect Flag.

BitField.name: VDDHI
BitField.description: VDD Overvoltage Flag.

BitField.name: VGL
BitField.description: Voltage Glitch Detection Flag.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT0
BitField.description: External Sensor 0 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT1
BitField.description: External Sensor 1 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT2
BitField.description: External Sensor 2 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT3
BitField.description: External Sensor 3 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT4
BitField.description: External Sensor 4 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSTAT5
BitField.description: External Sensor 5 Detect. The tamper detect is only active when it is enabled. This bits needs to be cleared in software after a tamper event to re-arm the sensor.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN0
BitField.description: External Sensor 0 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN1
BitField.description: External Sensor 1 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN2
BitField.description: External Sensor 2 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN3
BitField.description: External Sensor 3 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN4
BitField.description: External Sensor 4 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: EXTSWARN5
BitField.description: External Sensor 5 Warning Ready flag. The tamper detect warning flags are set, regardless of whether the external sensors are enabled.

BitField.name: BORF
BitField.description: Battery-On-Reset Flag. This bit is set once the back up battery is conneted.

BitField.name: SHIELDF
BitField.description: Die Shield Flag.

BitField.name: LOTEMP
BitField.description: Low Temperature Detect.

BitField.name: EN
BitField.description: SPI Enable.

BitField.name: MASTER
BitField.description: Master Mode Enable.

BitField.name: SS_IO
BitField.description: Slave Select 0, IO direction, to support Multi-Master mode,Slave Select 0 can be input in Master mode. This bit has no effect in slave mode.

Enum.name: input
Enum.description: Slave Select 0 is input, only valid if MMEN=1.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start Transmit.

Enum.name: start
Enum.description: Master Initiates a transaction, this bit is self clearing when transactions are done. If a transaction cimpletes, and the TX FIFO is empty, the Master halts, if a transaction completes, and the TX FIFO is not empty, the Master initiates another transaction.

BitField.name: SS_CTRL
BitField.description: Start Select Control. Used in Master mode to control the behavior of the Slave Select signal at the end of a transaction.

Enum.name: DEASSERT
Enum.description: SPI De-asserts Slave Select at the end of a transaction.

Enum.name: ASSERT
Enum.description: SPI leaves Slave Select asserted at the end of a transaction.

BitField.name: SS
BitField.description: Slave Select, when in Master mode selects which Slave devices are selected. More than one Slave device can be selected.

BitField.name: TX_NUM_CHAR
BitField.description: Nubmer of Characters to transmit.

BitField.name: RX_NUM_CHAR
BitField.description: Nubmer of Characters to receive.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Phase.

Enum.name: Rising_Edge
Enum.description: Data Sampled on clock rising edge. Use when in SPI Mode 0 and Mode 2

Enum.name: Falling_Edge
Enum.description: Data Sampled on clock falling edge. Use when in SPI Mode 1 and Mode 3

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Polarity.

Enum.name: Normal
Enum.description: Normal Clock. Use when in SPI Mode 0 and Mode 1

Enum.name: Inverted
Enum.description: Inverted Clock. Use when in SPI Mode 2 and Mode 3

BitField.name: SCLK_INV
BitField.description: Reserved - Must Always Be Cleared to 0.

BitField.name: NUMBITS
BitField.description: Number of Bits per character.

BitField.name: DATA_WIDTH
BitField.description: SPI Data width.

BitField.name: THREE_WIRE
BitField.description: Three Wire mode. MOSI/MISO pin(s) shared. Only Mono mode suports Four-Wire.

BitField.name: SS_POL
BitField.description: Slave Select Polarity, each Slave Select can have unique polarity.

BitField.name: SRPOL
BitField.description: Slave Ready Polarity, each Slave Ready can have unique polarity.

Register.name: SS_TIME
Register.description: Register for controlling SPI peripheral/Slave Select Timing.

BitField.name: PRE
BitField.description: Slave Select Pre delay 1.

Enum.description: 256 system clocks between SS active and first serial clock edge.

BitField.name: POST
BitField.description: Slave Select Post delay 2.

Enum.description: 256 system clocks between last serial clock edge and SS inactive.

BitField.name: INACT
BitField.description: Slave Select Inactive delay.

Register.name: CLK_CFG
Register.description: Register for controlling SPI clock rate.

BitField.name: LO
BitField.description: Low duty cycle control. In timer mode, reload[7:0].

Enum.name: Dis
Enum.description: Duty cycle control of serial clock generation is disabled.

BitField.name: HI
BitField.description: High duty cycle control. In timer mode, reload[15:8].

Enum.name: Dis
Enum.description: Duty cycle control of serial clock generation is disabled.

BitField.name: SCALE
BitField.description: System Clock scale factor. Scales the AMBA clock by 2^SCALE before generating serial clock.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_LEVEL
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO level that will trigger a DMA request, also level for threshold status. When TX FIFO has fewer than this many bytes, the associated events and conditions are triggered.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_EN
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO enabled for SPI transactions.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_CLEAR
BitField.description: Clear TX FIFO, clear is accomplished by resetting the read and write pointers. This should be done when FIFO is not being accessed on the SPI side. .

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Clear the Transmit FIFO, clears any pending TX FIFO status.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_CNT
BitField.description: Count of entries in TX FIFO.

BitField.name: TX_DMA_EN
BitField.description: TX DMA Enable.

Enum.name: DIS
Enum.description: TX DMA requests are disabled, andy pending DMA requests are cleared.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_LEVEL
BitField.description: Receive FIFO level that will trigger a DMA request, also level for threshold status. When RX FIFO has more than this many bytes, the associated events and conditions are triggered.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_EN
BitField.description: Receive FIFO enabled for SPI transactions.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_CLEAR
BitField.description: Clear RX FIFO, clear is accomplished by resetting the read and write pointers. This should be done when FIFO is not being accessed on the SPI side.

Enum.name: CLEAR
Enum.description: Clear the Receive FIFO, clears any pending RX FIFO status.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_CNT
BitField.description: Count of entries in RX FIFO.

BitField.name: RX_DMA_EN
BitField.description: RX DMA Enable.

Enum.name: dis
Enum.description: RX DMA requests are disabled, any pending DMA requests are cleared.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: SPI active status. In Master mode, set when transaction starts, cleared when last bit of last character is acted upon and Slave Select de-assertion would occur. In Slave mode, set when Slave Select is asserted, cleared when Slave Select is de-asserted. Not used in Timer mode.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: SPI data.

BitField.description: SPI data.

BitField.description: SPI data.

BitField.description: SPI Master Mode Enable.

Enum.description: SCLK idles High (1) after character transmission/reception.

BitField.description: Phase Select.

Enum.description: Transmit on inactive edge of SCLK.

BitField.description: Transmit Status.

BitField.description: Transmit Underrun.

BitField.name: TX_LJ
BitField.description: Transmit Left Justify.

BitField.description: Slave Select 1. If SPI is enabled and in master mode, the SSEL_1 is driven according to this bit.

BitField.name: SSL2

BitField.name: SSL3

Register.name: SPIMSS0_BRG
Register.description: Baud Rate Reload Value. The SPI Baud Rate register is a 16-bit reload value for the SPI Baud Rate Generator. The reload value must be greater than or equal to 0002H for proper SPI operation (maximum baud rate is PCLK frequency divided by 4).

BitField.name: BRG
BitField.description: Baud Rate Reload Value.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_LEVEL
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Level. Set the number of free entries in the TxFIFO when a TxDMA request occurs.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_CLEAR
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Clear.

BitField.name: TX_FIFO_CNT
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Count.

BitField.name: TX_DMA_EN
BitField.description: Transmit DMA Enable.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_LEVEL
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Level. Sets the RX FIFO DMA request threshold. This configures the number of filled RxFIFO entries before activating an RxDMA request.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_CLEAR
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Clear.

BitField.name: RX_FIFO_CNT
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Count.

BitField.name: RX_DMA_EN
BitField.description: Receive DMA Enable.

BitField.name: I2S_EN
BitField.description: I2S Mode Enable.

BitField.name: I2S_MUTE
BitField.description: I2S Mute transmit.

BitField.name: I2S_PAUSE
BitField.description: I2S Pause transmit/receive.

Enum.name: halt
Enum.description: Halt transmit and receive FIFO and DMA access, transmit 0's.

BitField.name: I2S_MONO
BitField.description: I2S Monophonic Audio Mode.

Enum.name: monophonic
Enum.description: Monophonic audio format.Each transmit data word is replicated on both left/right channels. Receive data is taken from left channel, right channel receive data is ignored.

BitField.name: I2S_LJ
BitField.description: I2S Left Justify.

Enum.name: replaced
Enum.description: Audio data is synchronized with SSEL.

RegisterGroup.name: TMR0
RegisterGroup.description: 32-bit reloadable timer that can be used for timing and event counting.

Register.name: CNT
Register.description: Count. This register stores the current timer count.

Register.name: CMP
Register.description: Compare. This register stores the compare value, which is used to set the maximum count value to initiate a reload of the timer to 0x0001.

Register.name: PWM
Register.description: PWM. This register stores the value that is compared to the current timer count.

Register.name: INTR
Register.description: Clear Interrupt. Writing a value (0 or 1) to a bit in this register clears the associated interrupt.

BitField.name: IRQ_CLR
BitField.description: Clear Interrupt.

BitField.name: TMODE
BitField.description: Timer Mode.

BitField.name: PRES
BitField.description: Prescaler. Set the Timer's prescaler value. The prescaler divides the PCLK input to the timer and sets the Timer's Count Clock, F_CNT_CLK = PCLK(HZ)/prescaler. The Timer's prescaler setting is a 4-bit value with pres3:pres[2:0].

BitField.name: TPOL
BitField.description: Timer input/output polarity bit.

BitField.name: TEN
BitField.description: Timer Enable.

BitField.name: PRES3
BitField.description: MSB of prescaler value.

BitField.name: PWMSYNC
BitField.description: Timer PWM Synchronization Mode Enable.

BitField.name: NOLHPOL
BitField.description: Timer PWM output 0A polarity bit.

BitField.name: NOLLPOL
BitField.description: Timer PWM output 0A' polarity bit.

BitField.name: PWMCKBD
BitField.description: Timer PWM output 0A Mode Disable.

BitField.name: NOLLCMP
BitField.description: Non-overlapping Low Compare. The 8-bit timer count value of non-overlapping time between falling edge of PWM output 0A and next rising edge of PWM output 0A'.

BitField.name: NOLHCMP
BitField.description: Non-overlapping High Compare. The 8-bit timer count value of non-overlapping time between falling edge of PWM output 0A' and next rising edge of PWM output 0A.
